ratings.comment: One of my fav prof, his lectures were always engaging and each class always had discussion. Minimal homework, long assignments with clear criteria, and lots of time to complete. Only exams were midterm and final besides weekly quizzes on the previous week's content.

Prof. Morgul is a sweetheart who clearly has a passion for what he is teaching. Very easy class if you pay attention. Only real hw is an online weekly quiz posted over the weekend and is based off of lectures. He post all of his powerpoint and makes deep connections to topics in class. I really enjoyed this class!

Amazing professor! Lectures are very interesting and the prof is genuinely just a nice guy who is passionate about the course and wants you to learn. He doesn't believe in exams so grades are solely based on participation and short assignments. If you go to lectures and submit all the assignments, it's an easy A.

Homework doesnt take too long, lectures are interesting and Professor Morgul shows a real passion for his specialty, and does a great job trying his best to spread that passion in a way that isnt unreasonably difficult or expects too much of students. Get ready to read a good amount (the texts arent that bad), and theres about 5 short essays

He is a very good professor, and so caring. He is honestly one of my favorite professors, and the class is interesting. The assignments take time, but the topics are interesting. If you are thinking about taking the class, definitely do it!

I would highly recommend professor Morgul, SOC134 was one of my favorite courses I've taken. There is no exams- just 5 homework assignments that are super interesting and relatively quiz, one short canvas quiz a week, and a couple readings (also super interesting) that you skim and make a few comments on. Super caring, funny guy, engaging lectures.

Kerem is amazing! Super kind guy and makes lectures very interesting and fun. The class overall is an easy A, only weekly quizzes and some homeworks but no tests. His lectures are filled with information that really opens your eyes to new things and even his homeworks are interesting and fun to do! Definitely recommend him:)

SOC 134 is a very easy A! There are no midterms or finals and very easy weekly quizzes. The lectures are interesting and it is important to learn about these topics! Recommend if you want an interesting class with a kind, caring and funny Professor!
Karem is a great professor and has a great teaching style. I really looked forward to his lectures and the group research projects.

Personally, I really liked Kerem! I thought that he was very knowledgable and that he honestly cared to help his students learn the material! I really appreciated Kerem's class and I was glad I got to be apart of it!

We did two group projects during the 8-week summer term, first a survey project and then a qualitative interview project. We chose our own research topics/questions, so the projects were fun and motivating. Overall, Kerem was great and I learned a lot about sociology methods.

Not only was this class incredible, Kerem may possibly be the nicest and most caring professor I have ever met. He was so accommodating of me when I had a serious wrist injury. He cares about his students not only during, but after the semester is finished. Extremely interesting info, easy tests & hw. Take this class with Kerem he is the BEST!

Dr. Morgul has a good sense of humor and genuinely is passionate about what he teaches. However, the lectures are a little boring since the slides are just read off. Did not go to the lectures the last few weeks, crammed for the final, and still did good. Extra credit is offered, and top hat is used.

While there is a textbook, I only did the reading the first two weeks. All the content is gone over during lecture. Three easy homework assignments and one midterm. Lectures are very fast and sometimes have tophat questions - so I would show up if you don't want to read and still pass.
His lectures are very fast and lots of information. Grade is only based on one exam, 3 homework assignments & a final. Overall do not suggest.
He's a really funny guy who prevents info in a very organized manner. Tests were a little misrepresentative of material. Overall good experience
